title: Ticket #2692: Add -cron argument for condor_q
description:
I'd like a(nother) new option to condor_q, -cron. This would list all the cron jobs.

There are two types of "cron" jobs: - jobs that have one of the Cron* attributes set (cronweek, cronhour, etc) - jobs that use a deferral time to restart every so often

I'd like to know about both types of jobs, but maybe it is not appropriate for the deferral jobs to be in the cron output?

The default format to display information about these jobs should not be the standard condor_q output. As a possible improvement, here is what I do in RSV. I use "condor_q -l" to determine a bunch of information about the job and output in the following format, notably including the "Next Run Time". 

[kronenfe@osg-edu osg]$ rsv-control -j

<snip>
     ID OWNER      ST NEXT RUN TIME   METRIC
  288.0 rsv        I  12-05 18:15     org.osg.certificates.cacert-expiry
  289.0 rsv        I  12-06 01:12     org.osg.local.containercert-expiry
<snip>
